description: Students investigate contemporary approaches to classical issues in metaphysics, which
include the mind-body problem; personal identity and immortality; space and time;
causality; and realism, anti-realism, and truth. Specific issues discussed vary from year
to year. May be repeated if topic is different.  Offered alternate years.
Prerequisites: two courses in philosophy, one of which must be either PHIL 235
or PHIL 236 or permission of the department chair.
